name: Colombia
introduction: Colombia was one of the three countries that emerged from the collapse of Gran Colombia in 1830 (the others are Ecuador and Venezuela). A five-decade-long conflict between government forces and antigovernment insurgent groups principally the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) heavily funded by the drug trade escalated during the 1990s. More than 31000 former paramilitaries had demobilized by the end of 2006 and the United Self Defense Forces of Colombia as a formal organization had ceased to function. In the wake of the paramilitary demobilization emerging criminal groups arose whose members include some former paramilitaries. The insurgents lacked the military or popular support necessary to overthrow the government. Large areas of the countryside were under guerrilla influence or contested by security forces. After four years of formal peace negotiations the Colombian Government signed a peace deal with the FARC in November 2016 which was subsequently endorsed by the Colombian Congress. The agreement calls for members of the FARC to demobilize and be incorporated into mainstream society and politics. The Colombian Government has stepped up efforts to reassert government control throughout the country and now has a presence in every one of its administrative departments. Despite decades of internal conflict and drug related security challenges Colombia maintains relatively strong democratic institutions characterized by peaceful transparent elections and the protection of civil liberties.
overview: 'Colombia is a country at the northern tip of South America. It''s landscape is marked by rainforests Andes mountains and numerous coffee plantations. In the high-altitude capital Bogotá the Zona Rosa district is known for its restaurants and shops. Cartagena on the Caribbean coast has a walled colonial Old Town a 16th-century castle and nearby coral reefs.'

languages.name: Achagua
languages.area: Rio Meta near Puerto Gaitan.

languages.name: South Levantine Arabic
languages.area: Also in Argentina, Egypt, Israel, Kuwait, Libya, Palestinian West Bank and Gaza, Puerto Rico, Syria.

languages.name: Andaqui
languages.area: Southern highlands.

languages.name: Andoque
languages.area: Amazonas, Aduche River (tributary of Caquetá) 15 km downriver from Araracuara.

languages.name: Arhuaco
languages.area: Southern slopes of Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.

languages.name: Waimaha
languages.area: Southeastern Vaupés region, tributaries of mid and upper Pira-Paraná, upper Papurí and Tiquié, Mitú. Also in Brazil.

languages.name: Emberá-Baudó
languages.area: Baudó River basin and Pacific (north) coastal rivers between cabo corrientes; south of San Juan River, near Northern Emberá.

languages.name: Muinane
languages.area: Amazonas, Upper Cahuinarí, on Caquetá tributary.

languages.name: Bora
languages.area: Northeast Yaguasyacu, Putumayo, Ampiyacu River area. 5 villages. Also in Brazil, Colombia.

languages.name: Barbacoas
languages.area: Near Barbacoas coastal town, Nariño.

languages.name: Barasana-Eduria
languages.area: Southern Vaupés region, Pira-Paraná River and tributaries. Jepa Matsi in Brazil may be dialect.

languages.name: Cabiyarí
languages.area: Cananarí River (tributary of the Apaporis and Vaupés).

languages.name: Carapana
languages.area: Vaupés region, Caño Tí (tributary of middle Vaupés River) and upper Papurí and Pirá-Paraná rivers. Also in Brazil.

languages.name: Carijona
languages.area: Upper Vaupés, Yarí, and lower Caquetá rivers, south of Miraflores, around Puerto Nare.

languages.name: Chimila
languages.area: Central Magdalena Department, lowlands south and west of Fundación, and scattered.

languages.name: Cacua
languages.area: Lower Vaupés region, Wacará, 30 kilometers east of Mitú.

languages.name: Carabayo
languages.area: Amazonas Department, halfway between San Bernardo and Pure rivers. At least 3 long houses.

languages.name: Emberá-Chamí
languages.area: Departments of Risaralda, Caldas, Antioquía, Valle, including Caramanta Municipality.

languages.name: Mandarin Chinese
languages.area: Widespread north of Changjiang River, a belt south of the Changjiang from Qiujiang (Jiangxi) to Zhenjiang (Jiangsu), Hubei, except southeast corner, Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, northwest part of Guangxi, and northwest corner of Hunan. Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Canada, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Laos, Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Mongolia, Mozambique, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam, Zambia.

languages.name: Cocama-Cocamilla
languages.area: Northeast lower Ucayali, lower Marañon, and Huallaga rivers area. Also in Brazil, Colombia.

languages.name: Koreguaje
languages.area: Orteguaza and Caquetá rivers and tributaries, Caquetá region.

languages.name: Cofán
languages.area: Both sides of the Colombia and Ecuador border, Napo Province near Santa Rosa de Sucumbios, and down Aguarico River about 130 km, Sucumbios Province. 5 centers in Ecuador, and scattered between. Also in Colombia.

languages.name: Caramanta
languages.area: Antioquía region, Municipio de Jardín, near cities of Andes, Christiania.

languages.name: Emberá-Catío
languages.area: Upper Sinu, San Jorge, San Pedro, Murri rivers. Also in Panama.

languages.name: Cubeo
languages.area: Vaupés region, Vaupés, Cuduyari, Querarí rivers and tributaries. Also in Brazil, Venezuela.

languages.name: Cuiba
languages.area: Meta Casanare, Capanapara rivers and tributaries. Also in Venezuela.

languages.name: Desano
languages.area: Northwestern Amazonas. Also in Colombia.

languages.name: German
languages.area: Also in Argentina, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Bolivia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Brazil, Canada, Chile, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Ecuador, Estonia, Finland, France, Hungary, Israel, Italy, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Moldova, Mozambique, Namibia, Paraguay, Philippines, Poland, Puerto Rico, Romania, Russian Federation (Europe), Slovakia, Slovenia, South Africa, Switzerland, Tajikistan, Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United States, Uruguay, Uzbekistan.

languages.name: Northern Emberá
languages.area: Southeastern Panama, Darién area, lowland jungle. Also in Colombia.

languages.name: French
languages.area: Also in Algeria, Andorra, Austria, Belgium, Benin, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Cameroon, Canada, Central African Republic, Chad, Comoros, Congo, Côte d’Ivoire, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Equatorial Guinea, French Guiana, French Polynesia, Gabon, Guadeloupe, Guinea, Haiti, India, Israel, Italy, Lebanon, Libya, Luxembourg, Madagascar, Mali, Martinique, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mayotte, Monaco, Morocco, Mozambique, New Caledonia, Niger, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Réunion, Rwanda, Saint Pierre and Miquelon, Saudi Arabia, Senegal, Seychelles, South Africa, Switzerland, Togo, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, U.S. Virgin Islands, Vanuatu, Wallis and Futuna.

languages.name: Playero
languages.area: Arauca Division, Venezuela border, banks of Arauca River from Gaviotas Island to Arauca.

languages.name: Wayuu
languages.area: Guajira Peninsula, Caribbean coast. Also in Venezuela.

languages.name: Guahibo
languages.area: Plains regions, Casanare, eastern Meta, Vichada, Guaviare, Guainia states. Also in Venezuela.

languages.name: Guambiano
languages.area: Central Andes Range near Popayán, Cauca, in concentrated areas.

languages.name: Guayabero
languages.area: Metá and Guaviaré states, Upper Guaviaré River.

languages.name: Guanano
languages.area: Northwest Amazonas. Also in Colombia.

languages.name: Minica Huitoto
languages.area: Upper Igara-Parana. Caquetá River at Isla de los Monos, Caguan River near Sanvicente del Caguan.

languages.name: Murui Huitoto
languages.area: Northeast Peru, southwest Colombia. Ampiyacu, Putumayo, and Napo rivers; north of Amazon River between Iquitos, Peru and Leticia, Colombia on the south, Caquetá River north. Also in Colombia.

languages.name: Islander Creole English
languages.area: San Andrés and Providencia Islands.

languages.name: Inga
languages.area: Sibundoy Valley, Santiago area, San Andrés, and Colón; Aponte, Department of Nariño. 1,000 in Bogotá, some in regional capitals. Also in Venezuela.

languages.name: Jungle Inga
languages.area: Upper Caquetá and Putumayo rivers.

languages.name: Jamaican Creole English
languages.area: Also in Canada, Costa Rica, Dominican Republic, Panama, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Hupdë
languages.area: northwest Amazonas, Rio Auari. Also in Colombia.

languages.name: Camsá
languages.area: Putumayo region, Sibundoy Valley, near Ingas.

languages.name: Cogui
languages.area: North, east, and west slopes of Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.

languages.name: Curripaco
languages.area: Guainia, Isana, and Inirida rivers. Also in Brazil, Venezuela.

languages.name: Border Kuna
languages.area: North coast region near Panama isthmus. Also in Panama.

languages.name: Awa-Cuaiquer
languages.area: Pacific slopes of Andes, Nariño, from Ecuador border north, near Barbacoas. Also in Ecuador.

languages.name: Macaguán
languages.area: Arauca, Agualinda, and San José de Lipa between the Lipa, Ele, and Cuiloto rivers and Caño Colorado; other scattered locations.

languages.name: Malayo
languages.area: South and east slopes of Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.

languages.name: Nukak Makú
languages.area: Jungle region between Guaviare and Inirida rivers, up to Mapiripan. Near Charco Caimán.

languages.name: Macaguaje

languages.name: Barí
languages.area: Oro and Catatumbo rivers region. Also in Venezuela.

languages.name: Macuna
languages.area: Vaupés region, lower Pira-Parana; Apaporis tributaries and Miriti-Parana. Also in Brazil.

languages.name: Woun Meu
languages.area: Southeast Panama, lowlands. Also in Colombia.

languages.name: Ocaina
languages.area: Northeast Peru, Yaguasyacu, Ampuyacu, and Putumayo rivers. Also in Colombia.

languages.name: Páez

languages.name: Pijao

languages.name: Piapoco

languages.name: Piratapuyo

languages.name: Palenquero
languages.area: San Basilio de Palenque village southeast of Cartagena, and 2 neighborhoods in Barranquilla.

languages.name: Providencia Sign Language
languages.area: Providencia Island off Nicaraguan coast.

languages.name: Puinave
languages.area: Territory of Guainia, Inírida River and tributaries. Also in Venezuela.

languages.name: Napo Lowland Quechua
languages.area: Napo River region; communities on the Putumayo; Madre de Dios. Also in Colombia, Ecuador.

languages.name: Vlax Romani
languages.area: Also in Albania, Argentina, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Brazil, Bulgaria, Canada, Chile, Colombia, France, Germany, Greece, Italy, Mexico, Moldova, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Russian Federation (Europe), Slovakia, Spain, Sweden, Ukraine, United Kingdom, United States.

languages.name: Epena
languages.area: South Pacific coast, Caucá, Nariño, Chocó departments. Also in Ecuador, Panama.

languages.name: Sáliba
languages.area: Meta and Casanare rivers. Also in Venezuela.

languages.name: Siona
languages.area: Both sides of Putumayo River. Also in Ecuador.

languages.name: Spanish
languages.area: Central, south; Canary Islands. Also in Andorra, Anguilla, Argentina, Aruba, Australia, Belgium, Belize, Bolivia, Canada, Cayman Islands, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Cuba, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, El Salvador, Equatorial Guinea, Finland, France, Germany, Gibraltar, Guatemala, Honduras, Israel, Jamaica, Mexico, Morocco, Netherlands Antilles, Nicaragua, Norway, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Sweden, Switzerland, Trinidad and Tobago, United States, U.S. Virgin Islands, Uruguay, Venezuela.

languages.name: Siriano
languages.area: Vaupés region, Paca and Vina rivers. Also in Brazil.

languages.name: Tariana
languages.area: Amazonas, Middle Vaupés River, Santa Rosa (Juquira), Iauarete, Periquitos, and Ji-Ponta. Also in Colombia.

languages.name: Tatuyo
languages.area: Vaupés region, Pira-Paraná headwaters and Upper Papurí.

languages.name: Barro Negro Tunebo
languages.area: Isolated, Andes foothills, edge of eastern plains above Paz de Ariporo, in Barro Negro, San Lope (Casanare), and Tabías (Casanare), south of Tame Arauca.

languages.name: Ticuna
languages.area: West Amazonas. Also in Colombia, Peru.

languages.name: Emberá-Tadó
languages.area: Chocó Departamento, Upper San Juan River region.

languages.name: Tama (Colombia)
languages.area: Caquetá region, Vicente, Orteguaza River.

languages.name: Tinigua
languages.area: Metá Department, Sierra de la Macarena. Formerly in Llanos de Yarí, Caquetá Department.

languages.name: Western Tunebo
languages.area: Santander del Sur.

languages.name: Tanimuca-Retuarã
languages.area: Amazonas region, Guacayá, Oiyaka rivers (tributaries of the Mirití-Parana), Mirití-Parana, Apaporis, and Popeyaka rivers near mouth of Pira River below Popeyaca.

languages.name: Totoro
languages.area: 17 km west of Silvia, Cauca, in Totoro town.

languages.name: Tuyuca
languages.area: Inambu, Tiquie, and Papurí rivers. Also in Brazil.

languages.name: Central Tunebo
languages.area: North slopes of Sierra Nevada de Cocuy, Boyaca and Arauca regions; Satocá, Calafita, Tegría (Boyaca), Cobaría (Boyacá). Also in Venezuela.

languages.name: Tucano
languages.area: Amazonas. Wasonas primarily in Yacayacá village. Also in Colombia.

languages.name: Yagua
languages.area: Northeast Amazon River region, Loreto, from Iquitos to Brazil border. Also in Colombia.

languages.name: Pumé
languages.area: Orinoco, Sinaruco, Meta, and Apure rivers, Amazonas and Apure states.

languages.name: Yucuna
languages.area: Amazonas, Miriti-Parana (tributary Caquetá); La Pedrera on lower Caquetá, Ararcuara; Leticia.

languages.name: Yahuna
languages.area: Piraparana River, Umuqa River, a tributary.

languages.name: Nhengatu
languages.area: Amazonas, Lower Vaupés, Içana, and Negro River areas. Also in Colombia, Venezuela.

languages.name: Yurutí
languages.area: Upper Pacá River (tributary of Papurí), Caño Yi River (tributary of the Vaupes), and Caño Tuy River (tributary of the Vaupés). Also in Brazil.

languages.name: Yukpa
languages.area: Serranía de Perijá, Cesar Department, Municipio of Augustín Codazzi and neighboring municipalities north and south, Colombia-Venezuela border. Río Cascará dialect in Agustín Codassi Municipio along Casacará River and Caño Iroka. Caqo Padilla-La Laguna is small and farther north. Río Maracas is south in Becerril Municipio. Also in Venezuela.
